result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy J. Hodge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy J. Hodge

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 9:21 am case called. Defendant Timothy J. Hodge in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant. Statement by defendant-does not have a valid license. Statement by DA Blader regarding resolution.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: No Contest to Count 1 & 2.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 3. Court sentences the defendant to: Costs on each count to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA sample. 1 day of jail credit. Appeal Rights Given.
NOH remailed as per address change on Bond Form

ADDRESS INFO for Timothy J. Hodge
Current: 2621 Church Ave, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54495 United States  (Effective: 06-26-2015)
Prior: N5917 5th Ave, Plainfield, WI 54966

Pre-trial conference at 07-15-2015 09:15 am.
Status conference at 08-04-2015 09:15 am.
No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license for the methond of operation.

Case Called @ 1:31 PM: Defendant Timothy J. Hodge in court, in custody, with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.      Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per SPD:  Custody status will determine eligibility.  ADA argues as to bond - due to pending Adams Co case argues for high Signature or lower Cash Bond with No Op w/o a Valid DL.  SPD would agree with recommendation for a high Signature Bond.  Efforts on reinstatement continue.  The Court:  Orders $2500 Signature Bond w/No Op w/o Valid DL for method of operation.  Court questions Def as to status of counsel after today.  Def states he will more than likely require a Court Appt.  Def wishes to speak with the State on his own without counsel.      NGP entered by Court.   PTC/STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 09:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 09:15 am.
